Summary: Dick shows up with twins and a letter that changes everything. Jason comes home with a daughter and a heartbreak he can't fix, no matter how hard he tried. Damian returns without warning, carrying two sons—more responsibility than he’s ever known, and the certainty that he has no room left for pride. And Tim—Tim's world has shattered in a way that he doesn't know if he'll come back from. But he has to. For his son. Two weeks doesn’t sound like long—until you’re raising a baby alone. One by one, the Robins come home carrying infants, exhaustion, and a grief that refuses to wait for you to be ready. The kind that doesn't care how strong you are. What they find isn’t a mission or a mantle—but a family learning how to stand still long enough to heal. Bruce Wayne expects a productive day at the Batcomputer.Instead, he gets his sons back in a single heartbreaking evening. This is where the legacy begins.This is why the Robins came home.
